active_keybinding_map.description: Active keybinding map name (e.g., "default", "emacs", "vscode", or a custom name)

check_for_updates.description: Check for new versions on quit (default: true)

editor.description: Editor behavior settings (indentation, line numbers, wrapping, etc.)

keybinding_maps.description:
Named keybinding maps (user can define custom maps here)
Each map can optionally inherit from another map

keybindings.description: Custom keybindings (overrides for the active map)

languages.description: Per-language configuration overrides (tab size, formatters, etc.)

auto_indent.description: Automatically indent new lines based on the previous line

auto_save_interval_secs.description:
Auto-save interval in seconds for file recovery
Modified buffers are saved to recovery files at this interval.
Default: 2 seconds for fast recovery with minimal data loss.
Set to 0 to disable periodic auto-save (manual recovery only).

enable_inlay_hints.description: Whether to enable LSP inlay hints (type hints, parameter hints, etc.)

estimated_line_length.description:
Estimated average line length in bytes (used for large file line estimation)
This is used by LineIterator to estimate line positions in large files
without line metadata. Typical values: 80-120 bytes.

highlight_context_bytes.description:
Number of bytes to look back/forward from the viewport for syntax highlighting context.
Larger values improve accuracy for multi-line constructs (strings, comments, nested blocks)
but may slow down highlighting for very large files.
Default: 10KB (10000 bytes)

highlight_timeout_ms.description: Maximum time in milliseconds for syntax highlighting per frame

large_file_threshold_bytes.description:
File size threshold in bytes for "large file" behavior
Files larger than this will:
- Skip LSP features
- Use constant-size scrollbar thumb (1 char)
Files smaller will count actual lines for accurate scrollbar rendering

line_numbers.description: Show line numbers in the gutter

line_wrap.description: Wrap long lines to fit the window width

mouse_hover_delay_ms.description:
Delay in milliseconds before a mouse hover triggers an LSP hover request.
Lower values show hover info faster but may cause more LSP server load.
Default: 500ms

mouse_hover_enabled.description:
Whether mouse hover triggers LSP hover requests.
When enabled, hovering over code with the mouse will show documentation.
Default: true

recovery_enabled.description:
Whether to enable file recovery (Emacs-style auto-save)
When enabled, buffers are periodically saved to recovery files
so they can be recovered if the editor crashes.

relative_line_numbers.description: Show line numbers relative to cursor position

scroll_offset.description: Minimum lines to keep visible above/below cursor when scrolling

snapshot_interval.description: Undo history snapshot interval (number of edits between snapshots)

syntax_highlighting.description: Enable syntax highlighting for code files

tab_size.description: Number of spaces per tab character

custom_ignore_patterns.description: Custom patterns to ignore (in addition to .gitignore)

show_gitignored.description: Whether to show gitignored files by default

show_hidden.description: Whether to show hidden files (starting with .) by default

width.description: Width of file explorer as percentage (0.0 to 1.0)

HighlighterPreference.description: Preference for which syntax highlighting backend to use

KeyPress.description: A single key in a sequence

keys.description:
Key sequence for chord bindings (e.g., [{"key": "x", "modifiers": ["ctrl"]}, {"key": "s", "modifiers": ["ctrl"]}])
If present, takes precedence over key + modifiers

inherits.description: Optional parent keymap to inherit from

KeymapConfig.description: Keymap configuration (for built-in and user-defined keymaps)

highlighter.description: Preferred highlighter backend (auto, tree-sitter, or textmate)

textmate_grammar.description:
Path to custom TextMate grammar file (optional)
If specified, this grammar will be used when highlighter is "textmate"

args.description: Arguments to pass to the server

auto_start.description:
Whether to auto-start this LSP server when opening matching files
If false (default), the server must be started manually via command palette

initialization_options.description:
Initialization options sent during LSP initialize request.
Some language servers (like Deno) require specific options here.
For example, Deno requires `{"enable": true}` to enable completions.

Menu.description: A top-level menu in the menu bar

menus.description: List of top-level menus in the menu bar

MenuItem.description: A menu item (action, separator, or submenu)

enabled.description: Enable resource limiting (can be disabled per-platform)

max_cpu_percent.description:
Maximum CPU usage as percentage of total CPU (None = no limit)
For multi-core systems, 100% = 1 core, 200% = 2 cores, etc.

max_memory_mb.description: Maximum memory usage in megabytes (None = no limit)
